cs113.calendar.simpleview
Class SimpleView

java.lang.Object
  cs113.calendar.simpleview.SimpleView
All Implemented Interfaces:
View
public class SimpleView
extends java.lang.Object
implements View

Command line interface to the calendar. As an implementation of View, this class receives a Controller from the call to runView(). Operations then are performed on that controller, and Controller.writeAll() will be called before the application exits.

Author:
Owen Healy

Method Detail

parseEntryCommand

private void parseEntryCommand(java.lang.String[] args)
Starts the program by parsing the command supplied on the command line. If the result of the command is to enter interactive mode, that will happen without this method returning. This method might not return for a very long time.

Parameters:
args - Command line arguments.

login

private void login(User user)
Logs in the user and then goes into interactive mode. This method is not going to return for awhile. Errors that occur in here get sent to System.out, so we don't throw any exceptions.

Parameters:
user - The user to login as.

startInteractiveMode

private void startInteractiveMode()
Sets up interactive command and starts reading user input. Does not return for a long time.

setupEntryEngine

private void setupEntryEngine()
Sets up handlers for initial commands.

setupInteractiveEngine

private void setupInteractiveEngine()
Sets up handlers for interactive commands.

exitAfterCompletion

private void exitAfterCompletion()
Called by a command handler to cause the program to exit.

runView

public void runView(Controller controller,
                    java.lang.String[] args)
Starts the view running. This is the first method called.

Specified by:
runView in interface View
Parameters:
controller - The Controller on which the view should operate.
args - Command line arguments.

parseDate

private static java.util.Calendar parseDate(java.lang.String userString)
                                     throws DateFormatException,
                                            InvalidDateException
Throws:
DateFormatException - if the string is not in a format we want it to be in.
InvalidDateException - if this is not a possible date.

checkField

private static void checkField(java.util.GregorianCalendar cal,
                               int field,
                               int value,
                               java.lang.String name)
                        throws InvalidDateException
Checks the validity of a date field.

Parameters:
cal - Calender to operate on.
field - index of the field.
value - value of the field.
name - name of the field.
Throws:
InvalidDateException - if the field is not valid.

formatDate

private static java.lang.String formatDate(java.util.Calendar date)
Converts a date to spec'd string representation.

Parameters:
date - A Calednar date.
Returns:
a string representation in the form MM/DD/YYYY-HH:MM.

parseDateWithFeedback

private java.util.Calendar parseDateWithFeedback(java.lang.String string)
                                          throws InvalidDateException,
                                                 DateFormatException
Parses a date from a string, printing to stdout if something goes wrong.

Parameters:
string - The text supplied by the user.
Returns:
A Calendar representing the date.
Throws:
InvalidDateException - If the date is not meaningful.
DateFormatException - If the string is improperly formatted.

parseAppointmentWithFeedback

private Appointment parseAppointmentWithFeedback(java.lang.String descriptionString,
                                                 java.lang.String locationString,
                                                 java.lang.String startString,
                                                 java.lang.String endString)
                                          throws InvalidDateException,
                                                 DateFormatException
Creates an appointment from a string representation, telling the user about any problems via stdout. The Appointment object has NOT been saved, and must be added to the current user's appointments if that is desired.

Parameters:
descriptionString - text description.
locationString - text location.
startString - start time of event.
endString - end time of event.
Returns:
unsaved Appointment object
Throws:
InvalidDateException - If the dates are not nice.
DateFormatException - If the dates are not formatted correctly.

formatAppointment

private java.lang.String formatAppointment(Appointment app)
Creates a string representation of an Appointment of the same form as would be input by the user to create an appointment.

Parameters:
app - The Appointment to format.
Returns:
A string representation of the appointment.
